flawed_nl_solution:
The bus to Ryan's work takes 10 minutes longer than his bike ride, so it takes 10 + 30 = <<10+30=40>>40 minutes.
Ryan takes the bus 3 times a week, so the bus rides take 40 * 3 = <<40*3=120>>120 minutes a week.
His friend cuts 2/3 off his biking time, which is 2/3*30 = <<2/3*30=90/2>>90/2 minutes a week.
This means his friend takes 30-90/2 = <<30-90/2=-15>>-15 minutes to drive him.
Therefore, Ryan spends 120 + -15 + 30 = <<120+-15+30=135>>135 minutes every week commuting to work.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 20, not 90/2. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
